bio:
Hi, my name is Abdallah Yashir Ramsing. I've been a Software Developer for over 12 years now.

A fun fact about me is that I learned coding when 11 years, from Turbo Pascal to experimenting with Fox Pro, Microsoft Access, and Visual Basic.

Since then, I've had the opportunity of working in different systems such as ERP Systems, Stock Management, Payroll, Attendance & eCommerce.

I've also worked in different roles including SQL, Web & Mobile App Dev, Test Automation and Data Integration.

Even after all these years coding, I'm still passionate in mastering my craft but also contributing back esp. to the local community.

bio:
Although living on a tropical island, Jochen KirstÃ¤tter is a business owner and entrepreneur in different industry sectors. Mainly operating in the development of tailor-made software solutions since more than 20 years, he is also venturing into the world of cloud computing. You can either meet him at the regular meetups of the Mauritius Software Craftsmanship Community or reach him on X and Mastodon: @JKirstaetter.

Jochen is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) for Google Cloud and a Microsoft Most Valuable Programmer (MVP) for Developer Technologies for several years. He founded the now largest IT community in Mauritius, and organises the annual Developers Conference. Following his interest in cross-platform technologies he is also an organiser of the Google Developer Group (GDG) Mauritius.

bio:
Kherin Bundhoo is a passionate software engineer and AI practitioner from Mauritius, with a strong background in full-stack development, DevOps, and machine learning. He holds a Master's degree in Artificial Intelligence and has worked extensively with Python, Django, React, and cloud-native technologies to build scalable, data-driven applications.

Kherin's technical interests span infrastructure automation with tools like Docker, Ansible, and Terraform, as well as cutting-edge AI capabilities such as Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), vector search, and generative models. He actively explores real-world applications of AI, including document understanding for legal and medical domains, and mobile app development with Python-based frameworks like Flet.

Beyond software development, Kherin is an avid endurance runner and a dynamic public speaker, having delivered talks on topics ranging from Semgrep and software security to MLOps for Generative AI. His work often bridges practical problem-solving with emerging technology trends, making him a compelling voice in the tech community.

Whether he's automating CI/CD pipelines, designing AI-powered search systems, Kherin brings clarity, precision, and creativity to every project he touches.
